iso_spectral.definition: Isomorphic patterns in spectral interpretations across scales capture structural equivalences in eigenvalue/zero hierarchies—mappings where self-adjoint operators, spectra, and chaotic dynamics preserve relations invariantly. Core focus: Hilbert-Pólya conjecture positing Riemann zeta non-trivial zeros as eigenvalues of a self-adjoint operator, forcing critical line placement. Validated via category theory (e.g., spectral functors), random matrix universality, and cross-domain analogies (e.g., quantum chaos to arithmetic spectra per 2025 RMT refinements). Hard-to-vary invariants like self-adjoint reality enable forecasts; upgraded with tetralemma probes for paradox resolution (affirm spectral reality/deny off-line zeros/both in chaotic transitions/neither in non-self-adjoint gaps); scores >0.98 based on 2025 spectral abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from operator theory/web and spectral overlays (e.g., quantum Hamiltonians to zeta zeros).
Validate coverage across scales; flag explicit operator constructions as speculative (<5% variance bound).
Support sub-categories for compounds (e.g., RMT universality); integrate diachronic depth (early quantum analogs to 2025 arithmetic chaos models).
Export lean JSON; auto-export flagged speculations to Module 0 for ratification.
Yoneda-like embeddings consume regenerative_pool: Map pruned operator candidates into higher spectral equivalences.
